lines.text: Cold are the hands of time that creep along relentlessly, destroying slowly but without pity that which yesterday was young. Alone our memories resist this disintegration and grow more lovely with the passing years. Heh! That's hard to say with false teeth!
That's one of the tragedies of this life - that the men who are most in need of a beating up are always enormous.
I'm the Wienie King! Invented the Texas Wienie! Lay off 'em, you'll live longer.
Don't you know that the greatest men in the world have told lies and let things be misunderstood if it was useful to them? Didn't you ever hear of a campaign promise?
Tipping is un-American.
So this fellow gave you the look?
At his age it was more of a blink.
Seven hundred dollars! And sex didn't even enter into it, I suppose?
Sex always has something to do with it, dear.
Isn't it wonderful?
Sensational. But you haven't quite answered my question yet.
What question, dear?
Why this alleged old man gave you - how much is it?
Seven hundred dollars.
Seven hundred dollars. Why?
No reason.
Oh, is that so? He just - seven hundred dollars? Just like that?
Just like that.
I mean, sex didn't even enter into it.
Oh, but of course it did, darling. I don't think he'd have given it to me if I had hair like excelsior and little short legs like an alligator. Sex always has something to do with it, dear.
I see.
From the time you're about so big and wondering why your girlfriends' fathers are getting so arch all of a sudden. Nothing wrong - just an overture to the opera that's coming.
I'd marry Captain McGloo tomorrow, even with that name.
And divorce him the next month.
Nothing is permanent in this world - except for Roosevelt.
You don't marry someone you just met the day before; at least I don't.
But that's the only way, dear. If you get to know too much about them you'd never marry them.
You have no idea what a long-legged woman can do without doing anything.
Staterooms are un-American.

[Gerry has just found out that John is one of the richest men in the world]
I would step on your face!
That's quite all right, I rather enjoyed it.
Twice!
You made quite an impression.
You will care for me, though. I grow on people. Like moss.
What's knittin', kittens?
What's buzzin', cousins?
Do you happen to remember how much tip I gave the taxi driver?
Well, I didn't see the coin, but from his face, I think it was ten cents.
Tipping is un-American.

[Referring to Gerry's husband, whom Gerry has claimed she is divorcing]
There is a name for such reptiles, but I won't sully this sweet ocean breeze by mentioning it. I may not be exactly in the best of shape, but if ever I meet this Mr... "Jeffers," I'll thrash him within an inch of his life.
Oh, well then I hope you never meet him.
I suppose he's large?
Well, he's not small...
That's one of the tragedies of this life - that the men who are *most* in need of a beating up are ALWAYS enormous.

[Seeing Princess Centimilla and her male companion, Toto, for the first time]
Is that the Prince?
No. The Prince is all washed up. This is something new.
He might be a Duke.
Might be her tailor, too. She goes out with anything.

[Introducing Toto to her brother and Gerry]
This is Toto. Say "How do you do?", Toto.

[Exuberantly, with thick foreign accent]
Greetings!
Toto's a refugee - from his creditors, I think.
I might marry again and I might not. Maybe I'll become an adventuress.
I can just see you on a 26 foot boat.
You're thinking of an adventurer, an adventuress never travels on anything less than a 300 foot long yacht with an 80 man crew.
Anyway, men don't get smarter as they get older. They just lose their hair.
Don't you ever talk about anything but Topic A?
Is there anything else?
Chivalry is not only dead, it's decomposed.
You know Maude, somebody meeting you for the first time, not knowing you were cracked, might get the wrong impression of you.
Funny having to sleep with a sitting-room between us.
And the doors locked.
You don't have to worry about that.
Where'd you get that dress?
Why, that's what I've been telling you about!
What's that on your wrist?
It's just what you think it is, dear.
[He looks at the bracelet on her wrist]
What kind of stones are those?
Just what they look like.
Do you know what it feels like to be strangled by bare hands?
I don't begin and end with a smelter, you know.
Captain, we should have met sooner, and if I'd seen you around, we would have!
We should have met sooner. If I'd seen you around, we would have!
Of course, I'm crazy, I'll marry anybody.
Where'd you meet this Weenie King?
You'll die laughing!
All right, convulse me.
You're not being rude, dear, you're just being yourself.
Why is your breath coming faster?
Because you're squeezing me!
That's my wife, you dumb cluck!
You're not a burglar, are you?
Oh no, that was my grandfather. At least that's what they called him.
No, I'm not my grandfather, of course. He's dead, anyway.
Thank you for your chivalry.
Anytime from 8 to 12.
Hello, Snoodles, where'd you get the pretty girl?

[spoken very fast]
Look at that very handsome man. I wonder who he is. I don't think I've seen him around before. I thought I knew all the handsome men in this village.

[talking about his new name, "McGlew"]
I guess I'll have to stick with it.

You're married to me; that's like saying, you're *blind* to me. For a long time, I've been a part of you, just something to snuggle up to and keep you warm at night, like a blanket, but you can't *see* me any more than you can see the back of your neck.

Why don't you go away someplace? There must be somebody else who can use a houseguest, I can't be the only sucker in the world. Why don't you go to Havana? That's a nice place, and I'd treat you to a nice one-way ticket.
Havanag? Youg, meg? Havanag?
No-gh, Toto! You-gh Havana-gh, me-gh here!
Nitz.
I was afraid of that.
He's my husband.
He's your husband?
That's right.
Well, no wonder! I thought I was losing my grip.
The who is McGlue?
There is no McGlue.
Well, thank heavens for something. That name!
Oh, Captain - and thou.

[to "Capt. McGlew"/Tom Jeffers]
Are you still talking about that airport? You really take it on the chin, don't you?

Why not? If an idea has merit, it has merit. Sentiment and business don't belong in the same bed. After all, grandfather loathed oil, ya' know, it made his eyes water. But that didn't stop him from making millions out of it.

...she said that he said that he was going to take her down on his boat. I suppose she means yachit, but I don't see how no gentleman can give me a dime from New York to Jacksonville can have a yachit. Maybe a canoe o' a bicycle. Yassir!
Do I look like a suitcase stealer?
It's not how you look but how you act that counts in this world.

[shopping for clothes, trying another outfit with long white gloves]
Do you like this one?
Oh its lovely - but aren't the sleeves a little short?

[heavy French accent]
Oh that is for the bracelet Monsieur - that is what we call the bracelet length.
Oh - would you like a bracelet?

[Sales clerk nudges her]
Wha... what kind of a bracelet do you mean?
Any kind you like.
You mean with stones?
Certainly with stones, they are all the rage!
Why not, what kind of stones do you like?
Well...
Red - that is all the rage!
You mean like garnets?
Don't you think garnets are a little lifeless?
Oh...
